Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.api.index

Interface IndexProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IndexConfigProvider, MinimalIndexAccessor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDelegatingIndexProxy, AbstractSwallowingIndexProxy, ContractCheckingIndexProxy, DelegatingIndexProxy, FailedIndexProxy, FlippableIndexProxy, OnlineIndexProxy, PopulatingIndexProxy, RecoveringIndexProxy, TentativeConstraintIndexProxy
    public interface IndexProxy
extends MinimalIndexAccessor
    Controls access to IndexPopulator, IndexAccessor during different stages of the lifecycle of an index. It's designed to be decorated with multiple stacked instances. The contract of IndexProxy is
    • The index may not be created twice
    • The context may not be closed twice
    • Close or drop both close the context
    • The index may not be dropped before it has been created
    • newUpdater and force may only be called after the index has been created and before it is closed
    • It is an error to not close an updater before doing any other call on an index
    • It is an error to close or drop the index while there are still ongoing calls to update and force
    See Also:
    ContractCheckingIndexProxy

      • awaitStoreScanCompleted

        boolean awaitStoreScanCompleted​(long time,
                                TimeUnit unit)
                         throws IndexPopulationFailedKernelException,
                                InterruptedException
        Parameters:
        time - time to wait maximum. A value of 0 means indefinite wait.
        unit - unit of time to wait.
        Returns:
        true if the call waited, false if the condition was already reached.
        Throws:
        IndexPopulationFailedKernelException
        InterruptedException

      • validateBeforeCommit

        void validateBeforeCommit​(Value[] tuple,
                          long entityId)
        Validates a Value so that it's OK to later apply to the index. This method is designed to be called before committing a transaction as to prevent exception during applying that transaction.
        Parameters:
        tuple - value tuple to validate.
        entityId - id of the entity being validated
